entry.title: writing reading 1
entry.content:
Q Some people think books are losing importance as a source of information and entertainment. to what extent do you agree?
A
with globalization of the world, it is becoming easier to get the information on the internet. some argue books are not important anymore as online website have cumulated immornouse information. i will elaborate on my perspective of this argument further in the following paragraph.

With the globalization of the world, it is becoming easier to access information on the internet. Some argue that books are no longer important since online websites have accumulated enormous amounts of information. In the following paragraph, I will elaborate on my perspective regarding this argument
when we read the book with paper, we can protect our eyesight from various dexitorious lights such as microwave and bluelight. morever, we can utilize our aother sensory motor system to appreciate reading mood entirely which eventually award us on some extent of satisfaction and enjoyness.

When we read a book on paper, we can protect our eyesight from various detrimental lights, such as microwaves and blue light. Moreover, we can engage our other sensory and motor systems to fully appreciate the reading experience, which ultimately rewards us with a certain level of satisfaction and enjoyment.
however, when it comes to learning, according to one of artificial intelligence researches conducted on agent simulated in the computer from MIT university, we can optimize our knowledge more accurately when we learn following curiousity by maximizing information gain. but when we learn with the book, the information they produce to be obsorved restricted in some aspect besides hard to find which aspect hinder us to learn actively with having curiousity. but when we learn something on the internet, we can search what we used to want to know whenever we want enabling us to learn actively resulting our knowledge optimized.

However, when it comes to learning, according to one of the artificial intelligence research studies conducted at MIT University on computer-simulated agents, we can optimize our knowledge more accurately by following curiosity and maximizing information gain. On the other hand, learning with books may restrict the information they provide in some aspects, making it difficult to identify the specific areas that hinder active learning and curiosity. In contrast, learning something on the internet allows us to search for the information we want to know whenever we want, enabling us to learn actively and resulting in optimized knowledge
In summerize, I believe the significance of reading the book stay still at the aspect of giving us the sufficient opportunity of feeling fulfillment and enjoy. But they are not most useful means anymore as internet come to us as secondary unlimited and handy resourse of information.

In summary, I believe that the significance of reading books remains in providing us with ample opportunities for fulfillment and enjoyment. However, they are no longer the most useful means, as the internet has emerged as a primary, limitless, and convenient resource of information.
entry.summary: Q Some people think books are losing importance as a source of information and entertainment. to what extent do you agree? A with globalization of the world, it is becoming easier to get the information on the internet. some argue books are not important anymore as online website have cumulated immornouse information. i will elaborate on my perspective of this argument further in the following paragraph.

entry.title: voca (colloqual, words)
entry.content:
colloqual

a mass of
dozens of
tons of
umpteen
a scrap of
I gather
Incidentally

in excess of
somewhere in the region of
or so
dash
stacks of
or whatever
and things like that / and that kind of thing.
something along those lines
or words to that effect

Mumble
mutter
slagging off
whining
chatting away
winding him up
get tongue-tied

words

86
overhang
overshadowed
undermine
proliferate

guilt-ridden
crime-ridden
bedridden

upend
end up
uphold
hold up
outdo
do out
outrun
run out
upset
set up
entry.summary: colloqual a mass of dozens of tons of umpteen a scrap of I gather Incidentally in excess of somewhere in the region of or so dash stacks of or whatever and things like that / and that kind of thing. something along those lines or words to that effect Mumble mutter slagging off whining chatting away winding him up get tongue-tied words 86 overhang overshadowed undermine proliferate guilt-ridden crime-ridden bedridden upend end up uphold hold up outdo do out outrun run out upset set up

entry.title: voca (metaphore)
entry.content:
metaphore

formidable
dismal
ludicrous

be on the ball
rule of thumb
dim
trickling

threw me completely
got our wires crossed
I’m not with you. / You’ve lost me there
to be fed up to the back teeth

Come over
put forward
come off
come under
stay on
dwell on
catch on
going on
brush up on
laid off
thrown himself into

entry.title: voca (communication)
entry.content:
agree

assent countenance endorse clamp down veto

complain

I’ve just about had enough of this is just not on I’m not at all satisfied with I wish to complain about I take great exception to I really must object to grouse *

apology

phoney * alibi flimsy pretext remorse acquitted armistice accord ceasefire

compliment

back-handed compliment double-edged compliment pay tribute to ovation extol plaudit laud

promise

promise someone the earth/moon oath / to swear swears by pledge vowed wager
entry.summary: agree assent countenance endorse clamp down veto

entry.title: voca (Health, Industry)
entry.content:
Health


ophthalmologists (eyes),
cardiologists (heart),
psychiatrists (the mind),
dermatologists (skin),
gynaecologists (women’s reproductive systems),
obstetricians (pregnancy and childbirth),
paediatricians (children),
anaesthetists (anaesthesia or stopping people from feeling pain during surgery)
prescription charge

off-colour
out of sorts *
fighting off
cuts and bruises
stinging *
throbbing *
feverish
nauseous
on the mend
be back on her feet *

low-dose
bowel
adverse reactions
stools
disorientation
prognosis *
a rash of *
jaundiced * 황달?
infect 전염?

clog
cholesterol
cardiovascular
brisk walking
scored an own goal
moving the goalposts
level playing field
neck and neck
skate around
sailed through



Industry

inward investment
on piecework.
zero hours contracts
Child labour
sweatshops
switch production
entry.summary: Health ophthalmologists (eyes), cardiologists (heart), psychiatrists (the mind), dermatologists (skin), gynaecologists (women’s reproductive systems), obstetricians (pregnancy and childbirth), paediatricians (children), anaesthetists (anaesthesia or stopping people from feeling pain during surgery) prescription charge
